intro: Hemitelia contigua, commonly known as the white-flowered hemitelia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Hemitelia contigua is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
